description: Contraction of fardel, probably with some influence from the Irish fearann meaning a fourth, especially of land or oatcakes. In this specific sense, fearann itself may be a possible cognate from a Norse or Old English root.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A quarter of a thin oatmeal or flour cake.
Any such cake or bread, now especially an Irish speciality such as a soda farl or potato farl.

verbs.description: farl (third-person singular simple present farls, present participle farling, simple past and past participle farled)

examples: Down with the mainmast ! lay her at hull !  Farl up all her linens, and let her ride it out !
